chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: Before starting the installation, review the sample configurations offered by &productname; in . &productname; ships with highly tuned example configurations for each of these cloud models:
There are two methods for installation to choose from:

listitem.para: You can use a GUI that runs in your Web browser.
You can install via the command line that gives you the flexibility and full control of &kw-hos-phrase;.

chapter.para: You should use the GUI if:

listitem.para: You are not planning to deploy availability zones, L3 segmentation, or server groups functionality in your initial deployment.
You are satisfied with the tuned &vendor;-default &ostack; configuration.

chapter.para: Instructions for GUI installation are in .

note.para: Reconfiguring your cloud can only be done via the command line. The GUI installer is for initial installation only.

chapter.para: You should use the command line if:

listitem.para: You are installing a complex or large-scale cloud.
You are planning to deploy availability zones, L3 segmentation, or server groups functionality. For more information, see the .
You want to customize the cloud configuration beyond the tuned defaults that &vendor; provides out of the box.
You need more extensive customizations than are possible using the GUI.

chapter.para: Instructions for installing via the command line are in .
